title: Mastering Computer Network Fundamentals Using Adaptive Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Understanding of Operating Systems and Data Structures
context.additional_context: Learners access an adaptive platform via personal devices (BYOD), using network modeling applied to real-world cases as project themes.

learning_goals: They can explain the network communication process based on the TCP/IP 4-layer model and analyze real-world cases
They can compare the functions of each layer in the OSI 7-layer model and propose appropriate network troubleshooting solutions
They can complete a team-based network topology design project using PBL (Problem-Based Learning) and meet evaluation criteria
Through an adaptive quiz system, they can diagnose individual weak concepts (e.g., packet routing, bandwidth management) with over 80% accuracy

resources: Network Simulation Tools (e.g., Cisco Packet Tracer)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
